com.edugility.splain
Class ResourceBundleKey

java.lang.Object
  com.edugility.splain.ResourceBundleKey
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class ResourceBundleKey
extends Object
implements Serializable

An identifier of a particular resource within a ResourceBundle.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
ResourceBundle, Serialized Form

ResourceBundleKey

public ResourceBundleKey(String key)
Creates a new ResourceBundleKey that will return the supplied key from its getObject(Locale) method.

This constructor calls the ResourceBundleKey(String, ClassLoader, ResourceBundle.Control, String) constructor, passing null for the first three arguments and the supplied key for the fourth.

Parameters:
key - the String to return from the getObject(Locale) method; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if key is null
See Also:
ResourceBundleKey(String, ClassLoader, ResourceBundle.Control, String)

ResourceBundleKey

public ResourceBundleKey(String resourceBundleName,
                         String key)
Creates a new ResourceBundleKey.

This constructor calls the ResourceBundleKey(String, ClassLoader, ResourceBundle.Control, String) constructor, passing the supplied resourceBundleName as the first argument, null for the second and third and the supplied key for the fourth.

Parameters:
resourceBundleName - a fully-qualified class name identifying a ResourceBundle; may be null
key - a String identifying a resource within a ResourceBundle identified by the supplied resourceBundleName parameter, or, if that parameter is null or empty, the value to be returned from the getObject(Locale) method; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if key is null
See Also:
ResourceBundleKey(String, ClassLoader, ResourceBundle.Control, String)

ResourceBundleKey

public ResourceBundleKey(String resourceBundleName,
                         ResourceBundle.Control control,
                         String key)
Creates a new ResourceBundleKey.

This constructor calls the ResourceBundleKey(String, ClassLoader, ResourceBundle.Control, String) constructor, passing the supplied resourceBundleName as the first argument, null for the second, the supplied control for the third, and the supplied key for the fourth.

Parameters:
resourceBundleName - a fully-qualified class name identifying a ResourceBundle; may be null
control - a ResourceBundle.Control to use for instantiating ResourceBundles; may be null in which case the return value of the ResourceBundle.Control.getControl(List) method—supplied with the ResourceBundle.Control.FORMAT_DEFAULT constant—will be used instead
key - a String identifying a resource within a ResourceBundle identified by the supplied resourceBundleName parameter, or, if that parameter is null or empty, the value to be returned from the getObject(Locale) method; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if key is null
See Also:
ResourceBundleKey(String, ClassLoader, ResourceBundle.Control, String)

                         ResourceBundle.Control control,
                         String key)
Creates a new ResourceBundleKey.

resourceBundleName - a fully-qualified class name identifying a ResourceBundle; may be null
bundleLoader - a ClassLoader for passing to the ResourceBundle.getBundle(String, Locale, ClassLoader, Control) method; may be null in which case the return value of Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader() will be used instead
control - a ResourceBundle.Control to use for instantiating ResourceBundles; may be null in which case the return value of the ResourceBundle.Control.getControl(List) method—supplied with the ResourceBundle.Control.FORMAT_DEFAULT constant—will be used instead
key - a String identifying a resource within a ResourceBundle identified by the supplied resourceBundleName parameter, or, if that parameter is null or empty, the value to be returned from the getObject(Locale) method; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if key is null
Method Detail

getObject

public final Object getObject(Locale locale)
Attempts to load the ResourceBundle identified by this ResourceBundleKey and to return the resource in that bundle identified by this ResourceBundleKey.

If this ResourceBundleKey was constructed with a null resource bundle name, then the key that was supplied at construction time is simply returned as is.

This method may return null in rare edge cases only.

Parameters:
locale - the Locale for which an Object should be retrieved; may be null in which case the return value of the Locale.getDefault() method will be used instead
Returns:
a resource, or null
Throws:
MissingResourceException - if either an appropriate ResourceBundle could not be loaded or if the relevant resource within that ResourceBundle does not exist

toString

public final String toString()
Returns a non-null String representation of this ResourceBundleKey. The representation is of the key itself, not of the return value of the getObject(Locale) method.

This method never returns null.

The format of the String representation returned by this method may change at any time.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
a non-null String

valueOf

public static final ResourceBundleKey valueOf(String key)
Returns a new ResourceBundleKey that is appropriate for the supplied key.

This method calls the valueOf(ClassLoader, ResourceBundle.Control, String) method, passing null for the first two arguments and the supplied key for the last one, and returns its result.

This method never returns null.

Parameters:
key - the key to parse; must not be null
Returns:
a non-null ResourceBundleKey
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if key is null
MissingResourceException - if a ResourceBundle could not be loaded or a resource within a ResourceBundle could not be found

valueOf

public static final ResourceBundleKey valueOf(ClassLoader bundleLoader,
                                              ResourceBundle.Control control,
                                              String key)
Returns a new ResourceBundleKey that is appropriate for the supplied key.

This method never returns null.

The supplied key is checked to see if it is null or empty. If so, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

The non-empty key is then parsed into a maximum of two components:

  1. A bundle name. A bundle name is a String of the form normally supplied to ResourceBundle.getBundle(String, Locale, ClassLoader, Control)—that is, a fully-qualified class name whose segments are separated with periods ("."). This method uses Character.isJavaIdentifierStart(char) and its ilk to ensure that the bundle name conforms to the Java Language Specification requirements for class naming.
  2. A bundle key component, separated from the bundle name with a solidus ("/"; the solidus is part of neither the bundle name nor the bundle key). A bundle key is an arbitrary String that is legal for supplying to the ResourceBundle.getObject(String) method. Leading and trailing whitespace is removed.

If the bundle name after this parsing and normalization does not conform lexically to the requirements of a Java class name, then the entire supplied key is treated as a simple String, and no further attempts will be made to resolve it against a ResourceBundle.

If the bundle key after this parsing and normalization is empty, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Examples:

com.foobar.ErrorMessages/noSuchElement
A ResourceBundleKey whose bundle name is com.foobar.ErrorMessages and whose bundle key is noSuchElement.
com.foobar.ErrorMessages /noSuchElement
A ResourceBundleKey whose bundle name is null and whose bundle key is com.foobar.ErrorMessages /noSuchElement. This is because there is whitespace in the bundle name, so the entire key is treated as a simple String.
There was no file found with that name.
A ResourceBundleKey that wraps a simple String consisting of the text given.
com.foobar.ErrorMessages/ noSuchElement
A ResourceBundleKey whose bundle name is com.foobar.ErrorMessages and whose bundle key is noSuchElement.

Parameters:
bundleLoader - the ClassLoader to pass (ultimately) to the ResourceBundle.getBundle(String, Locale, ClassLoader, Control) method; if null then the return value of Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader() will be used instead
control - the ResourceBundle.Control to use when loading ResourceBundles; if null then the return value of Control.getControl(Control.FORMAT_DEFAULT) is used instead
key - the key to parse; must not be null
Returns:
a new ResourceBundleKey; never null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if key is null
MissingResourceException - if a ResourceBundle could not be loaded or a resource within a ResourceBundle could not be found
